page.title: XTC
page.t:
Welcome to X-Tended - Terran Conflict.

We recommend that you take a bit of time to set up your hotkeys, look into the Galactic News System, and adjust the difficulty in your Configuration Menu.
Look at your reputation while you're there, check your property list in the statistics centre - see if this gamestart suits you fine.

And, of course, don't forget that many things have changed - including the universe itself. One of the principles of XTC is exploration - so on you go.

Don't forget about your family!
WARNING: there is no return from X-treme difficulty level

This {17,40030} is the latest development in factory design has one configurable production line for weapon production. For actual production the factory needs the correct weapons data which can be bought from any race you have a good standing with.

This {17,40032} is the latest development in factory design has one configurable production line for shield production. For actual production the factory needs the correct shield data which can be bought from any race you have a good standing with.

This {17,40034} is the latest development in factory design has one configurable production line for missile production. For actual production the factory needs the correct missile data which can be bought from any race you have a good standing with.

This {17,40036} is the latest development in factory design has one configurable production line for ammunition production. For actual production the factory needs the correct ammunition data which can be bought from any race you have a good standing with.

For buying production data, you need to have a good relationship with the race that offers them and have enough credits available, a green name indicates this.\n\nPlease Note: If the factory is already in a production cycle, changes to production will be applied after the current cycle ends.

The {17,20012} is a mobile hydroponics station with processing facilities. It can grow a wide variety of plants and animals. The integrated processing facilities allow for automatic refining into consumable foods.

The {17,20146} is a mobile Solar Power Plant. It is equipped with a new thermolytic crystal grower which when activated allows it to switch Energy Cell production into self-sufficient mode. As with every Solar Power Plant, the actual production varies with sun strength, production data is shown here for 100% sun strength.
The {17,20016} is a general production facility and can produce a wealth of technology.

The {17,20144} is a mobile weapon, shield and missile forge. It has to be "trained" by disassembling a weapon, shield or missile of the desired type first, and then it is ready for production. There is a small risk to disassembling high-tech weaponry or high-payload missiles.

The {17,20014} is a mobile mining facility. It uses a special mining teleporter which allows it to beam minerals directly from an asteroid. In order for it to function, it has to stay within transporter range of an asteroid containing the desired mineral. As with every mine, the actual production rate varies with the asteroid's yield. Production data is shown for a yield 20 asteroid.

'ON' old name
'ID' ship id
'IS' ship id short

'HB' homebase
'HS' homebase sector
'HA' homebase sector abbreviation
'HR' homebase sector abbreviation with race

'SC' current ship sector
'SA' current ship sector abbreviation
'SR' current ship sector abbreviation with race

'CL' ship class

'TN' ship type normal
'TS' ship type short
'TA' ship type abbreviation

'PN' pilot name
'PS' pilot skill
'PM' pilot moral and aggression level

'FR' highleader, leader or follower
'FL' direct formation.leader
'FC' colours as formation id
'FF' written Greek letters as formation id
'FG' Greek letters as formation id
'FP' police letters (alpha, bravo, charlie) as formation id
'FI' ship-id inside formation

'NN' unique number for ship
'ZN' unique number for ship with leading zero

'WN' flight.wing

'Y0'-'Y9' clipboards

and all those of the XTM-Team
A list of creatures and stations created by the Lifeform AL module.
The AL:Lifeform module is currently locked.
It will be unlocked again once you finish the Dragonhunter storyline.
The AL:Lifeform module is currently shutting down.
Please wait 5 minutes before switching it on again.

It is a tazura of sad mourning for the people of \033WSECTOR\033X. According to eyewitnesses, a living creature attacked \033WPILOTNAME\033X who was traversing the sector in their SHIPTYPE. The OBJCLASS class ship stood no chance against the creature and was destroyed completely.

In the last few stazuras a tragic accident has been reported in \033WSECTOR\033X. It is thought that there was a tragic misunderstanding between the \033WLFTYPE\033X and \033WPILOTNAME\033X which led to the complete destruction of the SHIPTYPE flown by the unfortunate pilot. Boron authorities have requested that all pilots stay away from this poor, irritable creature so that it can eventually calm down and we can resume living in peaceful coexistence.

Attention, citizens of the Xaar's empire! An unholy creature has caused disorder in \033WSECTOR\033X this tazura when it destroyed a OBJCLASS class spaceship. The authorities are still investigating the incident, and minor space traffic delays have resulted in the immediate area. Please take alternative routes where possible.

Due to inferior piloting skills, \033WPILOTNAME\033X fell victim this tazura to a space creature in \033WSECTOR\033X. Split observers refer to it as \033WLIFEFORM\033X. The creature seems deadly, maybe interesting prey for next space hunting season.

This tazura, Teladi finance agents have encountered a creature which is able to live in space. A minor financial loss occurred when \033WPILOTNAME\033X was killed by the \033WLFTYPE\033X \(naming rights pending\). The agents are now evaluating which might be the best way to make profits from this creature. We will keep you updated.

This tazura, military forces in \033WSECTOR\033X were alerted by a report from space pilot \033WPILOTNAME\033X, who claimed to have encountered a new form of AGI. However, by the time our forces reached the location, their SHIPTYPE appeared to have been destroyed not by an AGI, but what turned out to be a lifeform travelling through space. Military observers will keep an eye on the creature nonetheless, even though it is biological in nature.
Aldrin citizen falls victim to space creature!

A living creature, now listed in our databases as \033WLIFEFORM\033X, took \033WPILOTNAME\033X by surprise and destroyed their SHIPTYPE while they were travelling through \033WSECTOR\033X. The pilot managed to eject before their ship exploded and escaped to the local Trading Station. The whereabouts of the creature is currently unknown, so please be cautious when travelling in or near to that sector.

Space Fuel has become scarce in \033WSECTOR\033X after a \033WLFTYPE\033X destroyed the SHIPTYPE belonging to \033WPILOTNAME\033X who was just arriving with a cargo hold loaded with booze. Unfortunately all the Space Fuel was lost in the destruction of the OBJCLASS. Another supplier has now arranged for a replacement delivery, but it will take some time.

It must have come as a complete surprise to pilots passing through \033WSECTOR\033X, especially those inbound for STATNAME. Only a few kilometres out from the station was something that looked like a living creature hovering in space. \033WRANDNAME\033X from the local Committee for Space Traffic Security has ordered a no-fly zone and called for scientists from the nearest base to investigate the creature and assess the danger posed by this lifeform.

What a tazura our Boron friends in \033WSECTOR\033X are having! They have actually made contact with a real live space creature. This friendly little creature showed some interest in the local STATNAME and lingered in the vicinity, completely oblivious to the ships flying around it. No hostile actions were reported, showing once more that peace is the natural order of the universe.

The \033WLIFEFORM\033X was observed by scouts from the local police force as it closed in on \033WSTATNAME\033X \033W\(IDCODE\)\033X. So far the creature has shown no malicious intent, but local forces are on guard and civilians have been ordered to stay away from the creature.

This tazura started with great promise when a \033WLFTYPE\033X was detected flying through the sector, heading for the local \033WSTATNAME\033X. Excited by recent rumours about a dangerous space creature, many Split warriors manned their fighters in the hope of an epic space hunt. However casualties were unexpectedly high as the Split began fighting amongst each other for the right to kill the creature. Authorities intervened after a couple of mizuras, suppressing further fights and thereby incidentally also saving the creature's life.

There is a new attraction in \033WSECTOR\033X. A \033WLFTYPE\033X is currently flying through the sector, and it was last seen close to STATNAME. Local merchant \033WRANDNAME\033X claims the 'right of first sight' and is now trying to charge 100¢ from every pilot who gets closer than two kilometres to the creature. Several other merchants have already appealed to the local Board of Traders, disputing RANDNAME's claim.

The ATF Science Corps has enforced a five kilometre no-fly zone in and around \033WSTATNAME\033X in \033WSECTOR\033X, driving away curious onlookers who were trying to get a closer view of the \033WLFTYPE\033X that is currently near the station. However, as the creature has shown no hostile intent so far, it is highly unlikely that the ATFSC will gain anything of military value from this episode. Flying restrictions are expected to be lifted in a couple of stazuras.

Alarm bells rang in SECTOR as an unidentified flying object was reported to local authorities. Expecting the worst, a military patrol was sent to intercept the object which by then had come to a halt near \033WSTATNAME\033X where it did little but become rather curious about this local station! It came as a pleasant surprise to the pilots that the intruder was actually a type of lifeform, and a peaceful one at that. Pilots are requested to stay away from the \033WLFTYPE\033X and not to disturb it.

We're not sure what it is, but it seems this unusual space entity is alive. The creature which appeared near to \033WSTATNAME\033X isn't doing any harm right now, but it is attracting unwanted attention. At the moment discussions are on-going and suggestions range from simply killing it, chasing it away, or even selling it to the highest bidder. No final decision has been made yet though.\n\nKali Jar - Pirates' Whispers

In space, nobody hears you scream. \033WPILOTNAME\033X might just have found the truth behind this old saying when all communication with their SHIPTYPE suddenly ceased, a few sezuras after they first noticed a strange object on their Gravidar. Their last reported position was in the LOCATION of \033WSECTOR\033X.

We are looking for our good friend \033WPILOTNAME\033X. Have you seen them or their SHIPTYPE? If so, please let us know and our gratitude will be yours forever. Their last reported location was in \033WSECTOR\033X where they were examining the LOCATION quadrant.\n\nRANDNAME
Location: \033WSECTOR\033X, LOCATION.\nProspect: marginal, exploitation rejected.\nNotes: Contact with \033WIDCODE\033X lost.
Split pilot \033WPILOTNAME\033X lost in \033WSECTOR\033X. Probably killed. Go to LOCATION of sector, take weapons. Exact revenge on whatever killed PILOTNAME. Happy hunting.

Teladi trade agent \033WPILOTNAME\033X has reported a great opportunity in the LOCATION of \033WSECTOR\033X. Our Board is looking for prospectors to investigate the area and high profits are expected. PILOTNAME did not deliver a second report and so the probability is high that they have already started making profits. Speed is therefore of utmost importance!

The last known position of ATF pilot \033WPILOTNAME\033X was the LOCATION of sector \033WSECTOR\033X whilst on a exploration mission. There is a reward of 500¢ for any information that leads to the recovery of either PILOTNAME or their SHIPTYPE, ID-Code IDCODE. Please report any useful information to the nearest ATF outpost.

Captain \033WPILOTNAME\033X of the SHIPNAME \(IDCODE\) reported this tazura the finding of a strange structure in the LOCATION quadrant of \033WSECTOR\033X. All communication with this pilot has been lost however since this initial report.

\033WPILOTNAME\033X, working as a freelance prospector, reported that they had located a structure in space which might serve as a new base for activities in that part of the universe. We are currently waiting for a more in-depth report, giving us more information about this place in the LOCATION of \033WSECTOR\033X.

{7212,6900} Notification:\n\nYou have just received your first entry in your {7212,6900}. To read the {7212,6900}, please assign a hotkey to it in the [yellow]Controls[/yellow] > [yellow]Interface[/yellow] configuration.

In your {7212,6900} you can find detailed descriptions of your important missions. Finished missions are marked in \033Ggreen\033X and active missions in \033Yyellow\033X.\nModified and new entries are marked with a {7212,6904} in front of them.
No chapters have been recorded yet.
